title: Pharma Virumque
summary:
Key ideas:
- Pharma companies have adjusted their strategies to appeal to doctors' ethical qualms
- Free lunches and samples are common pharma tactics
- Pharma companies try to associate positive feelings with their products
- Doctors may feel pressure to prescribe certain drugs due to marketing tactics
- Pharma companies may offer to sponsor doctors to promote their products

Key learnings:
- Many doctors may accept offers like free lunches or sample drugs
- Pharma companies may use sneaky tactics to promote their products
- Doctors may feel pressure to prescribe certain drugs due to marketing tactics
- Accepting pharmaceutical company money may be seen as unethical

Key questions:
- Is it ethical for doctors to accept free lunches or sample drugs from pharma companies?
- Should doctors feel pressured to prescribe certain drugs based on marketing tactics?
- Is it ethical for doctors to accept money from pharma companies to promote their products?
